intro: Bathysa multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered bathysa, is a perennial forb native to the central and eastern United States. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers in late spring. The plant is adapted to moist to wet soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Its flowers are typically visited by various pollinators, including bees and flies. Bathysa multiflora plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland ecosystems and is considered a valuable component of native plant communities.
